author: bridge-bot
content: <n0ble> we should see a split on CL in the first place, and ELs that are verifying can alleviate it, i don't see how they can make it worse

author: sky.cactus
content: I also don't see how the situation would be worse by ELs having mixed behavior.

author: sky.cactus
content: It would increase the chance that we fail to achieve finality, which is a good thing when there is a consensus failure.

author: barnabasbusa
content:
Quick recap of how things are looking by the different client teams for EIP 4895:
EL:
Besu: Not ready as of 10am Thursday (10th Nov)
Erigon: Not ready as of 10am Thursday (10th Nov)
Geth: Somewhat ready -> locally built docker image is available
Nethermind: Somewhat ready -> docker image provided (nethermindeth/nethermind:withdrawals_yolo)
Ethereumjs: In the testing by some client teams, we (devops) don't plan to test it anymore
CL:
Lodestar: Somewhat ready -> image locally built, but can't be used as a bootnode
Lighthouse: Not ready as of 10am Thursday (10th Nov)
Teku: Not ready as of 10am Thursday (10th Nov)
Nimbus: Not ready as of 10am Thursday (10th Nov)
Prysm: Somewhat ready -> image provided (gcr.io/prysmaticlabs/prysm/beacon-chain:capella) but a bug found in API implementation (/eth/v1/node/identity) fix coming in hot. Bug discussion: (https://discord.com/channels/476244492043812875/667761857209040916/1040193122338095104)

We expected to launch a withdrawal testnet at noon on 10th of Nov. However, we at this point this will have to be delayed as we won't be able to begin bootstrapping a network with prysm/lodestar as it stands right now, even though 2 EL clients would be ready to test.

author: barnabasbusa
content: Once we get a prysm bug fix, I'm going to begin testing with their new release, and hopefully we still going to be able to spin a testnet up by tomorrow.

author: arnetheduck
content: <@199561711278227457> looking at start-from-merge-genesis support, ran across this: https://github.com/status-im/nimbus-eth2/issues/4193#issuecomment-1307705413 - since the bellatrix follows altair, we conceptually assume that the chain went through `phase0->altair->bellatrix` and didn't skip `altair` - however, the genesis in shangdong has a version field that says `phase0` was "prev_version" - has this direct transition been specified somewhere more precisely?

author: parithosh
content:
ah interesting, so the genesis.ssz was generated with the `eth2-testnet-genesis` tool from proto. It sets the `previous_version` and `current_version` here: https://github.com/protolambda/eth2-testnet-genesis/blob/e6966a10f31b86a3222ef31c23f79ef3d62e7a8c/state.go#L28

i.e, its setting `previous_version` always as the genesis forkID and we just never had more than 1 fork, so I guess we never came across a bug to change it. 

I can change this to have `previous_version` as the last fork, i.e  `altair`'s forkID in case the forks are happening at genesis. That should be a `phase0->altair->bellatrix` as expected and keeps things clean. We would fix it in the the next relaunch of shandong, but other testnets can already have the fix in place. 

I am unsure why it didn't throw an error with other clients, perhaps they handle that field differently?
